Posts.EditableText: Just my 2p's worth: Freeware image [b:3ivbp2oj]editors[/b:3ivbp2oj] don't get a lot better than the GIMP (esp for photos) now in V2.0 form and a lot more PC friendly than it was before. VuPaint (still free I think) is pretty good for creating gfx from scratch. Don't have the URL to hand but a simple search will find it - look for the precompiled for windows binaries unless you are a masochist who wants to compile his own... If you are buying, best value all rounder IMHO (and from personal experience not second hand) is JASC Paint Shop Pro V8.1 - vector/raster good photo editing, scriptable - lots of graphics power for not a lot of money at all (compared to Adobe & Macromedia's offerings.) Think there was a freebie of PSP V5 given away on a UK mag not long ago - when V8 came out. V5 is actually still very useful and for free it has to be worth looking out. Al (MaDbRiT)
Posts.HTML:
Just my 2p's worth:

Freeware image editors don't get a lot better than the GIMP (esp for photos) now in V2.0 form and a lot more PC friendly than it was before.

VuPaint (still free I think) is pretty good for creating gfx from scratch.

Don't have the URL to hand but a simple search will find it - look for the precompiled for windows binaries unless you are a masochist who wants to compile his own...

If you are buying, best value all rounder IMHO (and from personal experience not second hand) is JASC Paint Shop Pro V8.1 - vector/raster good photo editing, scriptable - lots of graphics power for not a lot of money at all (compared to Adobe & Macromedia's offerings.)

Think there was a freebie of PSP V5 given away on a UK mag not long ago - when V8 came out. V5 is actually still very useful and for free it has to be worth looking out.


Al (MaDbRiT)

Posts.EditableText: GIMP seems pretty powerful (at least the Linux version does)... But I must admit it's not ideally user friendly IIRC... Irfan veiw has a couple of nice filters - I still want to use that "explosion" thingy to show someone exploding and then going bak again in an animated gif... Anyway, yeah - PhotoShop seems the way to go, I've heard alot of reviews about it and ALOT of people swear by it to create online graphics - next being PSP which is a worthy adversary especially for the price... Although I liked the bug in the last version I owned whereby in the trial version you just pressed canel on the pop-up window and the program still ran... Or the next version from that where you just opened a file using a special technique .
Posts.HTML:
